Class VariableSizeRepeatingGroupBuilder

java.lang.Object
express.mvp.myra.codec.runtime.struct.VariableSizeRepeatingGroupBuilder
public final class VariableSizeRepeatingGroupBuilder extends Object
A builder for writing repeating groups of variable-size elements.

Wire Format (Offset Table Encoding): 

[count:int32][offset0:int32][offset1:int32]...[offsetN-1:int32][element0_data][element1_data]...

Each offset is relative to the start of the element data region (after the offset table). This enables O(1) random access during reading.

Two-Phase Writing:

  1. Call beginWithCount(MemorySegment, long, int) to reserve space for count and offset table
  2. Call addString(String), addBytes(byte[]), or beginElement()/endElement(int) for each element
  3. Call finish() to finalize offsets and return total bytes written

Thread Safety: This class is NOT thread-safe.

Example Usage with Strings: 

VariableSizeRepeatingGroupBuilder builder = new VariableSizeRepeatingGroupBuilder();
builder.beginWithCount(segment, offset, 3);
builder.addString("hello");
builder.addString("world");
builder.addString("!");
int bytesWritten = builder.finish();

Example Usage with Nested Messages: 

VariableSizeRepeatingGroupBuilder builder = new VariableSizeRepeatingGroupBuilder();
builder.beginWithCount(segment, offset, 2);

// Element 0
long elementStart = builder.beginElement();
levelFlyweight.wrap(segment, elementStart);
levelFlyweight.setPriceNanos(100L);
levelFlyweight.setSize(50);
builder.endElement(LevelFlyweight.BLOCK_LENGTH);

// Element 1
elementStart = builder.beginElement();
levelFlyweight.wrap(segment, elementStart);
levelFlyweight.setPriceNanos(200L);
levelFlyweight.setSize(75);
builder.endElement(LevelFlyweight.BLOCK_LENGTH);

int bytesWritten = builder.finish();

  • Constructor Details

    • VariableSizeRepeatingGroupBuilder

      public VariableSizeRepeatingGroupBuilder()
      Creates a new builder for variable-size elements.

  • Method Details

    • beginWithCount

      public void beginWithCount(@NonNull MemorySegment segment, long offset, int count)
      Begins writing a repeating group with a known element count. This reserves space for the count field and offset table.
      Parameters:
      segment - the memory segment to write to
      offset - the offset within the segment where the group starts
      count - the number of elements that will be written
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if segment is null
      IllegalArgumentException - if count is negative

    • expectedCount

      public int expectedCount()
      Returns the expected element count.
      Returns:
      the count passed to beginWithCount

    • currentCount

      public int currentCount()
      Returns the number of elements written so far.
      Returns:
      the current element index

    • currentOffset

      public long currentOffset()
      Returns the current write position.
      Returns:
      the absolute offset where the next element data will be written

    • addString

      public VariableSizeRepeatingGroupBuilder addString(String value)
      Adds a string element to the group.

      Element Format: [length:int32][utf8_bytes]

      Parameters:
      value - the string value to add
      Returns:
      this builder for chaining
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if all expected elements have been written

    • addString

      public VariableSizeRepeatingGroupBuilder addString(String value, MemorySegment scratchBuffer)
      Adds a string element using a scratch buffer for UTF-8 encoding. This is more efficient than addString(String) for repeated calls.
      Parameters:
      value - the string value to add
      scratchBuffer - a pre-allocated buffer for encoding
      Returns:
      this builder for chaining

    • addBytes

      public VariableSizeRepeatingGroupBuilder addBytes(byte[] bytes)
      Adds a bytes element to the group.

      Element Format: [length:int32][raw_bytes]

      Parameters:
      bytes - the byte array to add
      Returns:
      this builder for chaining
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if all expected elements have been written

    • addBytes

      public VariableSizeRepeatingGroupBuilder addBytes(MemorySegment source, long offset, int length)
      Adds a bytes element from a MemorySegment slice.
      Parameters:
      source - the source segment containing the bytes
      offset - the offset within the source segment
      length - the number of bytes to copy
      Returns:
      this builder for chaining

    • beginElement

      public long beginElement()
      Begins writing a nested message element. Returns the offset where the caller should write the message data.

      After writing the message, call endElement(int) with the number of bytes written.

      Returns:
      the absolute offset where element data should be written
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if all expected elements have been written

    • endElement

      public void endElement(int bytesWritten)
      Ends writing a nested message element, advancing the write position.
      Parameters:
      bytesWritten - the number of bytes written for this element

    • addElement

      public <T extends express.mvp.roray.ffm.utils.memory.FlyweightAccessor> VariableSizeRepeatingGroupBuilder addElement(T flyweight)
      Convenience method to write a flyweight as an element.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the flyweight type
      Parameters:
      flyweight - the flyweight containing the data to write
      Returns:
      this builder for chaining

    • finish

      public int finish()
      Finishes writing the repeating group. Validates that all expected elements were written.
      Returns:
      the total number of bytes written (count + offset table + element data)
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if fewer elements were written than expected

    • finishPartial

      public int finishPartial()
      Finishes writing and allows fewer elements than originally expected. Updates the count field to reflect actual elements written.
      Returns:
      the total number of bytes written

    • segment

      public MemorySegment segment()
      Returns the underlying memory segment.
      Returns:
      the segment being written to

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Resets this builder, releasing the reference to the segment.
